document_title: Intestinal infections: Symptoms, causes and prevention
subsection_name: nhiem-trung-duong-ruot.json_4_When should I see a doctor?
subsection_content:
Patients should immediately contact their doctor if they notice the following serious symptoms:
Fever.; Severe abdominal pain; Appearance of blood or mucus in stools; Diarrhea lasts more than 2 – 3 days; The body shows signs of dehydration.
For children under 3 months old, parents should take them to the emergency room in the following cases:
The body shows signs of dehydration (not urinating, pale face, sunken eyes, cold hands and feet or very irritable).; Children have severe stomach pain; Fever.; Do not breastfeed.
For toddlers, below are serious signs of intestinal infection that require urgent contact with a doctor:
Continuous diarrhea that does not go away; Appearance of blood in stool.; Unusual weight loss.
Patients should contact their doctor immediately when symptoms begin to become serious
